intro: Shaferocharis villosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest areas. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a distinctive species within the orchid family.
